newsitem.title: USA: Xscribe chief financial officer resigns.
newsitem.headline: Xscribe chief financial officer resigns.

text.p: Xscribe Corp said Friday Chief Operating and Chief Financial Officer Bruce Myers has resigned, effective November 30, as part of a restructuring.
Evan Wyly and Donald Miller Jr also resigned as company directors, reducing the board to five from seven menbers.
The company said the changes were made in connection with the reorganization and downsizing necessitated by the recent sale of the company's court-reporting products business.
Furthermore, the company has decided to focus its efforts on its scanner business and move away from its court reporting business. It will operate primarily through its Photomatrix Corp unit.

"These cost-motivated decisions are part of the company's overall plans to reduce operating costs by at least $800,000 annually, effective no later than March 31, 1997," said Suren Dutia, Xscribe's president and chief executive officer.
"These cost reductions are designed to help our goal of returning to profitability in the near future," she added.
